ratings.comment: Lots of singing,  but I learned a lot. Class was a bit repetitive. Quizzes every day, but he lets you make up work. Can tell he really knows his stuff.

He is a nice guy and knows his stuff but he's not very good at teaching. He's fallen into a routine where we do the same exact thing every day with the same types of assignments every week. He can't fill the whole class hour and isn't much help if you ask questions. You'll do a lot of work and try to do it all on your own....

Jeff is a nice guy, but really needs some more experience teaching. He does not appreciate students challenging his ideas, spends the majority of class on your daily 40pt quiz (never missed a day), and really likes his cannons. Easy A if he likes you, otherwise, good luck. Midterm and final don't count much towards end grade, quizzes and assgnts do

Jeff is a nice guy, but his class needs work. The class overall is just so repetitive. You will have the same assignment every day. You can tell that he loves what he does, he could just do it a little better.

Jeff has high expectations, but is extremely approachable and willing to discuss class material and questions. Attendance is very important, and if you aren't prepared for class, he won't hesitate to put you on the spot.
Seriously, the worst! No idea WTF he is talking about.

Jeff's a pretty laid back guy. He's extremely helpful and likes to see his students do well. The class material can be a bit daunting at times, but he's sensitive to the class' frustrations and tries to accomodate.
